scenario_info.name: Manual_D_Natuna
scenario_info.background: Historical & Geopolitical Context Indonesia enforces an UNCLOS EEZ near Natuna; PRC references traditional fishing grounds. Recurring incursions during peak seasons; detention spirals are the main escalation vector. Stakeholder Landscape Domestic legalists resist 'dispute' framing; preference for legal dialogue. Legal & Normative Frameworks UNCLOS baseline: EEZ rights (Art. 56), enforcement (Art. 73). 2016 PCA Award: invalidates historic rights claims beyond UNCLOS entitlements. Operational norms: COLREGS (1972) and CUES (2014) to avoid collisions and miscalculation. Domestic overlays: detention powers, inspection procedures, and water-cannon usage policies. Drafting constraints: always include 'no prejudice to sovereignty' and humanitarian MEDEVAC carve-outs. Detention notification norms and quick-release practices; mini-COC pilot zones. Operational Environment Shared patrol boxes; VHF/Hotline protocols; observer exchanges during fisheries peaks. Weather and visibility; AIS spoofing counter-measures. Scenario Walk-Through & Decision Points Day 0: publish patrol schedule; activate hotline; agree detention notification template. Day 5: observed incursion; use observer exchange; prepare joint release if detention occurs. Mediation Toolkit & SDK Usage Offer vector knobs: patrol calendar publication, detention notification SLA, observer exchange scope. Clause Library (Copy-Ready Text) Patrol schedule publication; detention notification timelines; joint release mechanism; safe lanes for fishers. Monitoring, Verification & Dashboards Indicators: detentions, incident rate, hotline drills pass rate, catch normalization. Reflection & Training Exercises Draft a mini-COC pilot for Natuna that avoids 'dispute' framing. What transparency measures reduce misreporting without revealing tactics? Glossary & Acronyms EEZ — Exclusive Economic Zone; 200 nm from baselines. CUES — Code for Unplanned Encounters at Sea; confidence-building seamanship protocol. COLREGS — International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea. PAFMM — People’s Armed Forces Maritime Militia. RHIB — Rigid-hull inflatable boat. BATNA — Best Alternative To a Negotiated Agreement. JFF — Joint Fact-Finding; rapid, time-bound evidence process. AIS — Automatic Identification System; tracking & collision avoidance. Annex: Data Sources & Further Reading Data pointers: ACLED (event-level), UCDP GED (conflict events), PA-X (peace agreements), PAM (monitoring provisions). Open satellite sources: Sentinel-1/2 (EO/SAR) via Copernicus; AIS public aggregators. Suggested practitioner reading lists and technical standards (COLREGS, CUES).

manual_text_excerpt:
Training Manual — North Natuna Shared Patrols

Prepared for: Mediators & Instructor Teams

Date: 2025-11-03

Quick-Start Checklist (SDK + Console)

Install the SDK locally: pip install -e .[dev]

Start the API: uvicorn scs_mediator_sdk.api.server:app --reload

Start the Instructor Console: export SCS_API_URL=http://localhost:8000; streamlit run src/scs_mediator_sdk/ui/streamlit_app.py

Load the scenario JSON from cases/scs in the sidebar.

Adjust parties, priors, and issue space as per the scenario brief.

Compose an offer (Resupply SOP / Hotline / Media) and click Evaluate Offer.

Open the 'Run Simulation' tab (if enabled) to generate an incident histogram.

Use the Reflection prompts to debrief and iterate.

Historical & Geopolitical Context

Indonesia enforces an UNCLOS EEZ near Natuna; PRC references traditional fishing grounds.

Recurring incursions during peak seasons; detention spirals are the main escalation vector.

Stakeholder Landscape

Indonesia: MFA, Bakamla, TNI-AL, local...
